verses.roman:
bāṣpa-vyākulitāruṇāñcala-calan-netraṁ rasollāsitaṁ
helollāsa-calādharaṁ kuṭilita-bhrū-yugmam udyat-smitam
rādhāyāḥ kila-kiñcitāñcitam asau vīkṣyānanaṁ saṅgamād
ānandaṁ tam avāpa koṭi-guṇitaṁ yo 'bhūn na gīr-gocaraḥ

synonyms: bāṣpa—by tears; vyākulita—agitated; aruṇa-añcala—with a reddish tinge; calan—moving; netram—eyes; rasa-ullāsitam—because of being agitated by transcendental mellows; hela-ullāsa—because of neglectful jubilation; cala-adharam—moving lips; kuṭilita—curved; bhrū-yugmam—two eyebrows; udyat—awakening; smitam—smiling; rādhāyāḥ—of Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī; kila-kiñcita—with the ecstatic symptom named kila-kiñcita; añcitam—expression; asau—He (Kṛṣṇa); vīkṣya—after glancing over; ānanam—the face; saṅgamāt—even than embracing; ānandam—happiness; tam—that; avāpa—got; koṭi-guṇitam—millions upon millions times more; yaḥ—which; abhūt—became; na—not; gīḥ-gocaraḥ—the subject of being described.
translation: " 'Agitated by tears, Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī's eyes were tinged with red, just like the eastern horizon at sunrise. Her lips began to move with jubilation and lusty desire. Her eyebrows curved, and Her lotus-like face smiled mildly. Seeing Rādhārāṇī's face exhibit such emotion, Lord Śrī Kṛṣṇa felt a million times happier than when He embraced Her. Indeed, Lord Śrī Kṛṣṇa's happiness is not at all mundane.' "

purport.content: This is a quotation from the Govinda-līlāmṛta (9.18).
